docs.snippet: CHULUMANI, Bolivia, Feb. 9 -- With the rainy season drawing to a close in the Tamampaya River valley, Ricardo Misme, a Bolivian Aymara Indian, has finished planting a new plot of coca shrubs, the source of cocaine.

docs.snippet: The Bendix Corporation announced yesterday that its board had selected W. Michael Blumenthal as chairman and chief executive officer, effective April 1.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 1 -- Juan Maria Bordaberry, a 43-year-old conservative, today assumed the presidency of Uruguay with a notable lack of public enthusiasm and maximum security.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's new Govt effectively devalues peso by fixing it at 495 to US dollar for exports and 500 for imports on commercial money mkt; ends previous system under which official rate stood at 250 pesos to dollar but was subject to scale of commissions...
docs.abstract: Uruguay's new Govt effectively devalues peso by fixing it at 495 to US dollar for exports and 500 for imports on commercial money mkt; ends previous system under which official rate stood at 250 pesos to dollar but was subject to scale of commissions varying from 120 to 250 pesos according to purpose of exch operation

headline.main: Uruguayan Devaluation Set by New Government

docs.snippet: POMPTON LAKES -- The late Albert Payson Terhune, author of those beloved dog stories, lived in Wayne, a neighboring town, but he liked this community so much that he gave Pompton Lakes as his address.

byline.original: By JUNE BLUMSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 (Reuters) -- Uruguay today repealed most of the extensive curbs on civil liberties she had imposed to fight Tupamaro urban guerrillas, ending nearly three years of what one Congressman called "paraconstitutional rule."
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 (Reuters) -- Uruguay today repealed most of the extensive curbs on civil liberties she had imposed to fight Tupamaro urban guerrillas, ending nearly three years of what one Congressman called "paraconstitutional rule."
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Cong, 67-1, repeals most of civil liberties curbs imposed nearly 3 yrs ago to fight Tupamaros; measures had given police and soldiers wide powers of search and arrest, curtailed trade union activity by prohibiting strike publicity or meetings, restricted press reptg of guerrilla activities and allowed opening of mail arriving from 'undemocratic' countries; restrictions on repts of Tupamaro activities remain in force but most of other measures are lifted, including closing of newspapers that Govt considers endanger security; move to lift measures came from Broad Front coalition of Socialists, Communists and dissenters from 2 major parties; Pres Bordaberry's Govt, failing to boycott vote, submits draft of new natl security law to Cong to replace restriction; new law would empower Govt's exec branch to declare parts of Uruguay mil zones, mobilize citizens to nation's defense and impose new controls on press

headline.main: Uruguay Reinstates Most Liberties Lost 3 Years Ago

docs.snippet: THE 1972 National Park stamps series will be completed with issues for the little-known but impressive Wolf Trap Farm Park for the Performing Arts in Virginia on June 26, and for the well-known McKinley Park, Alaska, on July 28.

docs.snippet: Long before the 1971 election, it was clear that Uruguay's traditional democracy could survive only if large segments of the two big parties would work together to revive the economy, end Tupamaro terrorism and rebuild national unity. The failure of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Long before the 1971 election, it was clear that Uruguay's traditional democracy could survive only if large segments of the two big parties would work together to revive the economy, end Tupamaro terrorism and rebuild national unity. The failure of a leftist coalition at the polls showed that President Allende's pattern in Chile was not the inexorable wave of the future in the Americas, but it did not insure Uruguay's survival in freedom.
docs.abstract: ed contends Uruguayan Pres Bordaberry's 1st days in office have not been reassuring in light of fact that his aim of 'natl unity' Govt was blocked by both his Colorado party and opposition Blancos; notes that even before taking up Bordaberry's draft of new security law, Cong annulled several measures used against Tupamaros; says he is getting cooperation from his chief Colorado rival, J Battle, and may get some support from Sen Ferreira, Blanco candidate who nearly defeated him for Pres, if he perseveres in promised reforms; contends greater cooperation will be required from country's dem forces for Uruguayan econ and pol to recover

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 16 (Reuters) -- Official sources here said that German-born Johann Ehrmann, alleged by a Bogota magazine to be Martin L. Bormann, the Nazi war criminal, was-arrested by the police tonight in a remote jungle area of southern...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 16 (Reuters) -- Official sources here said that German-born Johann Ehrmann, alleged by a Bogota magazine to be Martin L. Bormann, the Nazi war criminal, was-arrested by the police tonight in a remote jungle area of southern Colombia.
docs.abstract: Colombian secret police bring Ger-born recluse J Ehrmann out of remote Amazon jungles of southern Colombia for investigation of whether he is M L Bormann, Hitler's former deputy; Ehrmann, 72, will have fingerprints taken for comparison with Bormann's prints, being sent from W Ger; action follows accusation by Seven Days, Bogota magazine, that Ehrmann is Bormann; magazine publishes picture of Ehrmann with old photo of Bormann and contends it has proof that Ehrmann is Bormann; Bormann was last seen in Berlin as city fell to USSR in Apr '45; Bormann's war activities noted

headline.main: Man Who Is Said to Be Bormann Is Reported Seized in Colombia
